author: Naresh Mitra
title: Assam opposing timing of South Asian Games
text:
GUWAHATI: The Assam government has come out against the 12th South Asian Games to be held in the state and in Meghalaya's capital Shillong, saying that the timing of the event clashed with state's major festival Bhogali or Magh Bihu.
According to the state government the timing of the sports event has been proposed to be held from January 10 to 20, while the Bhogali Bihu, festival of harvesting and feasting, starts from the middle of January.
Assam chief minister Tarun Gogoi's press adviser Bharat Narah in a statement said that during Bhogali Bihu festivity, offices and other government and non-governmental institutions remain close.
"The timing of the South Asian Games has been proposed that it clashes with the Bhogali Bihu festivity. Union minister of state for sports Sarbanando Sonowal is also an MP from Assam. He (Sonowal) should have realized the attachment and emotion associated with Bhogali Bihu festivity in the state. It is very unfortunate that despite representing Assam, Sonowal failed to understand the emotion of people in the state," Narah said in the statement.
Chief minister Tarun Gogoi said that the state government is ready to extend all cooperation in organizing the sports event, but it is not in favour with the present timing.
The state government has asked the sports ministry to postponed the timing of the proposed event so that inconvenience is avoided during the festivity
"We will request the centre to postpone the timing of South Asian Games after Bihu. If the sports event is held during Bhogali Bihu it will create problem," a statement from chief minister's office said.
